CHANGE.ITEM: *Proofed title page(s). *Reviewed structure. *Checked division-marking material at heads and feet of divisions (HEADS, CLOSER, OPENER, ARGUMENT, EPIGRAPH, SIGNED, BYLINE, etc.). *Added TYPEs to DIVs in order to validate. *Checked for N=""s. *Checked s. *Checked placement and completeness of PBs. *Checked for foreign, damage and missing-page GAPs, #, --. *Checked for LBs, startqs / endqs, q;s, {que}s, ABBRs and Qs. *Checked for FIGUREs and decorated initials. *Checked proofsheets and made corrections found there. *Corrected $$s and $word$s etc. *Converted $$s to GAP DESC="illegible" RESP="[vendor name]". *Revalidated.

DIV1.Q: AH QUANTUM EST IN REBUS INANE! PERSIUS.
DIV1.P: LONDON: Printed for H. PAYNE and W. CROPLEY, at Dryden's-Head, in Pater-Noster-Row. M.DCC.LXII.

LG.HEAD: II.
LG.L: Should keep, among their rapid cars,

LG.HEAD: III.
LG.L: And what Day drank of dewy balm,

LG.HEAD: IV.
LG.L: How quiet, now, the gamesome kid

LG.HEAD: V.
LG.L: The sweets, that bending o'er their banks,

LG.HEAD: VI.
LG.L: The Moon, preceded by the breeze

LG.HEAD: VII.
LG.L: And now, in silent pomp she rides,

LG.HEAD: VIII.
LG.L: Where TIME, upon the wither'd tree
I sit, from busy passions free,

LG.HEAD: IX.
LG.L: The wither'd tree was once in prime;
Thus, at the touch of ruthless TIME

LG.HEAD: X
LG.L: I'm lifted to the blue expanse:
Come SCIENCE, by my side, advance,

LG.HEAD: XI.
LG.L: Let us descend — The daring flight
And SCIENCE, in the maze of light,

LG.HEAD: XII.
LG.L: What are those wild, those wand'ring fires,
Vapours. How like the vague desires
That cheat the heart of MAN!

LG.HEAD: XIII.
LG.L: But there's a friendly guide! — a flame,

LG.HEAD: XIV.
LG.L: Amongst the russet shades of night,
And darts along the dusk; so bright,

LG.HEAD: XVI.
LG.L: How smooth that rapid river slides,
The poppies pendent o'er its sides
Have charm'd the waves to sleep.

LG.HEAD: XVII.
LG.L: Reflect — for as the river runs,

LG.HEAD: XVIII.
LG.L: That branching grove of dusky green,
Save, where a starry space between,

LG.HEAD: XIX.
LG.L: Old ERROR, thus, with shades impure,
Yet, sometimes, through the deep obscure,

LG.HEAD: XX.
LG.L: Sleep, and her sister Silence reign—
But hark—I hear a lamb complain,

LG.HEAD: XXI.
LG.L: To savage herds, that hunt for prey,
For having trod a devious way,

LG.HEAD: XXII.
LG.L: As luckless, is the virgin's lot
When hurried from the halcyon cot

LG.HEAD: XXIII
LG.L: She seeks the path of peace in vain,

LG.HEAD: XXIV.
LG.L: How bright the little insects blaze,
As proud, as if their painted rays

LG.HEAD: XXV.
LG.L: 'Tis thus, the pigmy sons of pow'r
Thus, glitter in the darken'd hour,

LG.HEAD: XXVI.
LG.L: The silver host that shone so bright,

LG.HEAD: XXVII.
LG.L: Repells the rough winds noisy rage,
And shields me from the shower.

LG.HEAD: XXVIII.
LG.L: The rancour, thus, of rushing fate,

LG.HEAD: XXIX.
LG.L: A raven, from some greedy vault
Bids me, and 'tis a solemn thought!

LG.HEAD: XXX.
LG.L: The port, that to its friendly home,

LG.HEAD: XXXI.
LG.L: Yon village, to the moral mind,
Where sleep hath lull'd the labour'd hind,

LG.HEAD: XXXII.
LG.L: 'Tis but the church-yard of the Night;
That offers to the mental sight,

LG.HEAD: XXXIII.
LG.L: From hence, I'll penetrate, in thought,
And tutor'd, hence, be timely taught,

LG.HEAD: XXXIV.
LG.L: A breeze succeeds the frightful blast,

LG.HEAD: XXXV.
LG.L: And HOPE, (just wand'ring from my breast)

LG.HEAD: XXXVI.
LG.L: Yes — When yon lucid orb is dark,
My soul, a more celestial spark,

LG.HEAD: XXXVII.
LG.L: Fann'd by the little lenient breeze,

LG.HEAD: XXXVIII.
LG.L: Can the lewd orgies of your nights,
Ye sons of rage, and wine!
An hour of Peace, like MINE!

DIV1.P: AN ELEGY ON A PILE OF RUINS.
